replies.text: Reddit knows to reverse Reddit, but Reddit also hates Sofi. Quite the conundrum. Ive been quietly holding for a while the the last year of financials have been quite optimistic
The shorts were all over it this morning.

Genuine question, as a somewhat newish investor in stocks. I was listening on earnings and checking the presentation. Everything beaten against estimates, best ever quarter, moneys flowing in, and once the market opens it crashes 10? Like what were those investors who sold expecting? Money and clients to just fall from the sky? I mean Im not going to sell, its the long term that matters if the companies solid. But in the short term, even with great news, a number of investors seem to just st themselves because God forbid, the lottery win didnt happen, just seems overly ridiculous, or am I missing something?

SoFi went up 42 in 1 month, and earnings were great but not spectacular. The shorts got their chance after the 42 hype and crashed the stock to 9.77. But the fundamentals are intact with Full year profitability. It just swung back up by 1.01 to 10.78 in 4.5 hours. This time is different and SoFi is retaining the great majority of the gain from the past month. I wont be surprise if SoFi gets above preannouncement Mondays closing price of 11.19 by Wednesday. I would be scare if I am shorting SoFi after this Mornings Q3 Earnings announcement.
Aaaand its down 7 today. Of course.
Its still a bank and banks get PEs around 1015 these days.
So helpful

It dumped because the new member growth missed estimates. They spend a shitload on marketing compared to other banks. The technology service revenue segment also experienced slower growth than estimates. This is the revenue sector that is supposed to be SOFIs big differentiation to other fintech.

OHHH MANNNN Im printing. But the puts I bought are long dated so its not up much. Im only up about 15 today on the puts I bought yesterday. Anyway, this company isnt going to have a good time going forward so Ill just keep holding these puts.

Soft is a good product, but its a digital bank in the grandscheme of things. They were a major proof point in filling a gap during low rates for both a good Ul and high savings yields. But looking forward, I just see other threats even outside of the traditional banking segment. The demographic isnt one I would count on either regarding loyalty and retention, speaking from my own experiences. Offer me higher yields and a sign up bonus and Im gone, its super easy to swtich accounts nowadays. Just seems like a low profit rat race in the long term.

True but theyre expected to go from 11 cents eps for 24 to 43 cents eps in 26. Thats a quadruple in 2 years and thats only analyst expectations which they consistently beat. Theyve guided to as high as 80 cents eps in 26. Adjusted ebidta margins have improved sequentially now guiding to 25 margins. Net income margin 9 vs 50 last year or 23 2023 trailing 9 months.
As long as you arent risking more than youre comfortable then youre good. Hold long term, dont worry about the next day week or month. Think forward.
As of today

SPACs launched a bunch of bad companies so the natural response was for a lot of people to just assume any SPAC is a bad company. That narrative still crops up on Reddit. Youll see SoFi judged for its beginnings as a SPAC. As far as the tech company part.... Revenue is still largely based on traditional banking models so its a bit of a tough sell to say its a tech company. But they are expanding with their payment service Galileo.
0 is not the default. 0 is when things suck.

Right, YTD is and theyre up 1. Real gangbusters. Yeah, an awful day pretty much wiping out nearly all YTD gains doesnt matter. The numbers speak for themselves alright, hemorrhaging money sure is good for business.
Its down 3 if you participated in the IPO

So, to get to the PE of 1015, they still need to essentially get to EPS of 1.00.66 per share. If they meet their lofty growth targets, then this is arguably fairly valued today. If you believe theyll meet their future expectation, then the question should be less of will they hit those targets, but instead how much will they grow afterwards in 20262027 and beyond. At that point the same percentage based growth will be unattainable, since it will be more of a mature company and less of a turnaround story.
Pick your favorite regional bank, and compare numbers and youll get an idea why this is overpriced and will eventually be valued like all the other banks!
I agree, I didnt put too much into it and also bought it way before it got hyped up so I think Im on the safe side for now.
And the previous quarter.
Who is hemorrhaging money? It climbed back to around 10.73 in just a few hours. bro is probably bagholding at 20

Thats a fair way to look at it. From my perspective, its conservative mgmt that has always beat and raised and outpaced analyst expectations theyve also called out in regards to 26 guidance that it didnt incorporate any new products which theyve had new launches since this guidance was released and will inevitably have more. I also personally disagree that a high growth fintech should be valued as a legacy bank most of which have sub 10 rev growth. If their tech platform really accelerates and gets deals with large financial institutions itll be hard to ignore its part of the valuation delta vs banks. Theyve also leaned into originating for other companies no capital loan origination and loan servicing revenue where they dont take on risk. Its possible that growth completely stagnates in 27 but I dont think itll be that mature of company by then. Right now massive tailwinds for company with interest rate cuts, regulatory changes driving demand for tech platform, significant demand for loans for higher income individuals which is Sofia bread and butter. Im extremely bullish over next year , not necessarily beyond that as there wont be as much comparative tailwinds.

If theres a regional bank expected to quadruple EPS over 2 years growing revenue 30 into tailwinds thats valued like a traditional bank please let me know Id gladly full port on it. I cant find a single one. And again they have a tech platform that is fundamentally different than any regional bank.
This quarter made the first profitable year I believe

Lol, nope, no stake. Project harder. Only bag Im holding is 1200 on NVDA. Wow, its only down 6.5 in a day and up an anemic 5 YTD. To answer your question, SoFi is hemorrhaging money, referring to all the years they bled net income.
Oh I see.
The thread youre replying to is proving theyre profitable? also just shot up to 11.40. awkward.
Yawn, Im so not impressed by your unprofitable meme stock almost hitting a respectable return YTD. Go simp somewhere else.

I also have positions in Sofi and while there was a ton of nonsense hype there is actually a solid core business there. They have a hefty valuation for a bank. Take your pick. NTDOY or NTDOF. Im investing in the Super Nintendo Switch and trying to abuse latecycle investor distrust with Nintendos new console track record. The successor sounds like its just iterative, so it should be fine. Bear in mind that Nintendo historically has an early August Pokemon Presents, and the big game reveals tend to have large, often temporary, upswings. Faith in the imminent future propels the stock, and it has downswings whenever the current situation is forced to be highlighted. Im expecting a media blitz this month, and maybe even some first words on the Zelda movie, to draw eyes away from the NOW.
